questionContent.body: If I was you, I would take the offer.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In hypothetical (unreal) conditionals, use “were” with “I,” even though it seems singular.

questionContent.body: Choose the synonym of the word "Abundant":

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: "Abundant" means existing or available in large quantities. "Plentiful" has a similar meaning.

questionContent.body: The museum is known for its ______ collection of ancient artifacts.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A unique collection stands out and is special.

questionContent.body: The teacher asked the students to remain ______ during the examination.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Silence is generally expected during exams.

questionContent.body: The artist used bold colors to ______ his emotions on the canvas.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Considering” all options ensures informed decision-making.

questionContent.body: We must wear protective gear while working in a ______ environment.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Hazardous environment” indicates a risky or dangerous setting.

questionContent.body: The heavy rains have ______ several low-lying areas in the city.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Heavy rains” often result in flooding in low-lying areas.

questionContent.body: Her speech was so ______ that the audience remained silent throughout.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A “captivating” speech holds the audience’s attention completely.

questionContent.body: The doctor advised him to avoid oily food to maintain a healthy ______.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A healthy lifestyle involves good eating habits and exercise.

questionContent.body: We need to submit the report by tomorrow, so let’s not ______ any more time.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Wasting time” implies losing valuable time unnecessarily.

questionContent.body: His performance in the last match was far from ______.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The phrase “far from impressive” means the performance wasn’t very good.

questionContent.body: Please make sure all the lights are turned off before you ______ the office.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Turning off the lights is typically done before leaving a place.

questionContent.body: The manager gave a detailed ______ of the new project during the meeting.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A manager would usually give an “explanation” of a new project to ensure clarity.

questionContent.body: He invested a lot of money in the project, hoping it would ______ great returns.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The phrase “bring great returns” means to yield a profit.

questionContent.body: This medicine should be taken only on a doctor’s ______.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Medical intake should be based on professional “advice.”

questionContent.body: The committee will meet tomorrow to ______ the final draft of the report.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Final drafts are “finalized” before submission.

questionContent.body: The children were playing in the park under the ______ of their nanny.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Supervision” refers to being watched or taken care of.

questionContent.body: The teacher appreciated the student’s ______ during the group project.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Sprained” is the correct verb when referring to twisting a joint like an ankle.

questionContent.body: The train was delayed ______ heavy fog in the morning.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Because of” explains the reason behind the delay.

questionContent.body: She was ______ when she heard that she had won the award.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Winning an award brings happiness, so “overjoyed” fits well.

questionContent.body: We must work together to find a ______ solution to this problem.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A lasting or “permanent” solution is generally preferable for solving problems.

questionContent.body: He speaks so softly that it’s hard to ______ what he’s saying.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Softly” indicates a low volume, so the appropriate verb is “hear.”

questionContent.body: The teacher gave a ______ explanation, making it easy for the students to understand the topic.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A clear and understandable explanation is described as “simple.”

questionContent.body: The new restaurant has gained a lot of popularity ______ its delicious menu.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Due to” properly connects the reason for the popularity.

questionContent.body: The athlete trained ______ for months to qualify for the national competition.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Diligently” means with care and effort, especially in training or studies.

questionContent.body: The charity event was organized to ______ funds for the local orphanage.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Raise funds” means to collect money for a cause.

questionContent.body: Please ______ your mobile phones before entering the auditorium.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Audiences are generally expected to turn off their phones to avoid disturbances.

questionContent.body: The road was closed due to heavy ______ caused by the landslide.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Landslides usually cause roadblocks and “traffic” jams.

questionContent.body: His consistent hard work and patience finally ______ off.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The idiom “paid off” means to result in success or reward.

questionContent.body: The teacher asked the students to remain ______ during the examination.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Silence is typically expected during exams to avoid disturbance or cheating.

questionContent.body: The scientist’s discovery could ______ the way we treat genetic diseases.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A groundbreaking discovery is likely to “transform” an area of study or practice.

questionContent.body: She was so tired that she could hardly keep her eyes ______ during the lecture.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Keeping eyes open” is a common expression when someone is very sleepy or exhausted.

questionContent.body: The detective was able to ______ the mystery using the smallest clues.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Detectives work to “solve” mysteries using evidence.

questionContent.body: The town is famous for its ______ views and peaceful atmosphere.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Scenic” means visually attractive, often used for beautiful views.

questionContent.body: It is important to ______ the source of information before sharing it.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Verifying ensures the accuracy of the information.

questionContent.body: The artist’s work was known for its vibrant colors and unique ______.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In art, “style” refers to the distinctive way an artist expresses themselves.

questionContent.body: Despite heavy rains, the match continued without any ______.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Weather might cause a “delay,” but the match continued.

questionContent.body: Her explanation was so ______ that everyone understood the concept immediately.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: If everyone understood, the explanation must have been “clear.”

questionContent.body: The company plans to ______ a new product line by the end of the year.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Launch” is commonly used when introducing a new product.

questionContent.body: The report was filled with data but lacked a clear ______.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: While data is important, without proper “structure” the report lacks clarity.

questionContent.body: The student was praised for her ______ attitude towards learning.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A positive, eager approach to learning is described as “enthusiastic.”

questionContent.body: The government announced new policies to ______ economic growth in rural areas.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Boost” means to increase or promote, fitting the positive intent of the policy.

questionContent.body: The hikers lost their way due to the ______ directions given by a passerby.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The hikers getting lost implies the directions were unclear or “confusing.”

questionContent.body: His calm and ______ nature made him a great mediator during arguments.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Impartial” means neutral or fair, ideal for mediators.

questionContent.body: After several warnings, the company was finally ______ for polluting the river.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Legal punishment for pollution is usually a monetary "fine."

questionContent.body: The documentary shed light on the ______ effects of climate change on coastal communities.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Devastating” means severely damaging, fitting with the context of climate change.

questionContent.body: The teacher asked the students to ______ their answers before submitting the test.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Review” means to check again, especially for corrections.

questionContent.body: The soldiers marched forward with great ______ despite the challenges ahead.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Marching despite challenges implies bravery, or “courage.”

questionContent.body: It took the artist several months to ______ the details of his masterpiece.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: "Perfect" here is a verb meaning to improve something until it’s flawless.

questionContent.body: The scientist was awarded a prize for her ______ contribution to renewable energy research.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: "Groundbreaking" means innovative or pioneering, appropriate in research context.

questionContent.body: The ancient temple stood as a ______ to the architectural brilliance of past civilizations.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A "tribute" honors something or someone; here, the temple honors ancient brilliance.

questionContent.body: The manager decided to ______ the meeting until next week due to scheduling conflicts.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: "Postpone" means to delay something to a later date, which fits this context.

questionContent.body: The children were ______ when they saw the magician pull a rabbit out of his hat.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The context of a magician suggests a sense of “amazement”.

questionContent.body: The novel’s plot was so ______ that readers couldn’t put it down.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Gripping” stories capture attention strongly.

questionContent.body: The factory was shut down due to repeated violations of ______ regulations.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Factories are commonly closed for breaching “safety” regulations.

questionContent.body: During the debate, she ______ all the points made by her opponent with

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Countered” means to oppose or refute, especially in an argument.

questionContent.body: The author’s latest novel is a ______ blend of mystery and science fiction.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Seamless” means smooth and well-integrated, appropriate for a blend of genres.

questionContent.body: The project was delayed due to a ______ in the supply of raw materials.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A delay caused by lack of materials implies a “shortage”.

questionContent.body: To everyone's surprise, the athlete ______ his previous record by a wide margin.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: One “breaks” a record to outperform it.

questionContent.body: The new intern made a great ______ on her first day with her professionalism and enthusiasm.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The phrase “great impression” is commonly used for a positive impact.

questionContent.body: The detective gathered enough ______ to link the suspect to the crime scene.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Evidence” is what links a suspect to a crime scene logically.

questionContent.body: The CEO's speech was filled with ______ about the company's future, instilling hope among employees.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The sentence indicates hope, making “optimism” the best fit.

questionContent.body: The book is different ___ what I expected.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The correct idiomatic expression is “different from.”

questionContent.body: He has been working here ___ five years.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “For” is used with a duration of time, like "five years".

questionContent.body: Despite being tired, she ___ to the gym.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The main verb needs to be in past tense to match the time context.

questionContent.body: The cake was divided ___ the children equally.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Among” is used when referring to more than two people.

questionContent.body: The manager insisted ___ attending the meeting.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The verb "insist" is followed by "on" + gerund.

questionContent.body: If I ___ you, I would apologize.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In hypothetical statements, “were” is used with “I” for the subjunctive mood.

questionContent.body: He is not only intelligent ___ also very humble.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The correct correlative conjunction is "not only... but also".

questionContent.body: She prefers coffee ___ tea.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The correct idiom is "prefer X to Y".

questionContent.body: The sky was so dark, it looked like it ___ rain.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Would” is used to indicate a future possibility from a past perspective.

questionContent.body: She ___ her homework before dinner.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The past tense “finished” is appropriate because the action happened before a specific point in the past (“before dinner”).

questionContent.body: Not only the students but also the teacher have submitted the project on time.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In “not only... but also” structures, the verb agrees with the subject closer to it → here, teacher (singular).

questionContent.body: There is many reasons why this plan won’t work.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Reasons” is plural, so the correct verb is are.

questionContent.body: Either the manager or the employees is responsible for the error.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: When subjects are joined by either/or, the verb agrees with the subject closer to it → here, employees (plural).

questionContent.body: If I was you, I would take the job offer.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In hypothetical or imaginary situations, use the subjunctive form → If I were you.

questionContent.body: The number of applications have increased significantly this year.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “The number” is treated as a singular subject, so the correct verb is has increased.

questionContent.body: The CEO and the chairman of the company is attending the conference.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: If the CEO and the chairman are two different people, we use are. The sentence implies two roles held by two people.

questionContent.body: Mathematics are one of the most challenging subjects for students.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Though Mathematics ends in "s", it is a singular subject → is.

questionContent.body: Neither of the answers seem to be correct.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Neither” is singular, so it should be followed by seems.

questionContent.body: The book, along with the notes, were found on the shelf.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is the book (singular). The phrase “along with the notes” is additional info and does not affect the verb.

questionContent.body: Every one of the team members have submitted their assignments.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Every one” is singular, so it takes the singular verb has submitted.

questionContent.body: The number of participants in the seminar have increased dramatically.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “The number” is a singular subject, so the correct verb is has increased.

questionContent.body: Not only the students but also the teacher are attending the workshop.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In "not only...but also" constructions, the verb agrees with the noun closer to it. Teacher is singular → is attending.

questionContent.body: She is one of those students who works hard and never complains.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The clause refers to those students, which is plural, so the verb should be work hard.

questionContent.body: The list of items, including pens, notebooks, and erasers, are on the desk.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is the list, which is singular, so the correct verb is is.

questionContent.body: Neither the manager nor the employees was available for the meeting.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In "neither...nor" constructions, the verb agrees with the noun closest to it. Employees is plural, so the correct verb is were available.

questionContent.body: Either the director or the actors is responsible for the delay.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: When using “either...or,” the verb agrees with the noun closest to it. Here, actors is plural → are responsible

questionContent.body: If I was you, I would take the opportunity.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In hypothetical situations, we use the subjunctive mood: If I were you.

questionContent.body: Each of the players are required to bring their own kit.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Each” is singular and takes a singular verb: is required.

questionContent.body: There is many reasons to support the new education system.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject “many reasons” is plural, so the verb should be are, not is.

questionContent.body: The committee have made its decision regarding the new policy.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “The committee” is treated as a singular unit here, so the verb should be singular: has made.

questionContent.body: The old man, together with his sons, were taken to the hospital.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is “The old man,” which is singular. The phrase “together with his sons” does not affect the verb agreement.

questionContent.body: Neither the manager nor his assistants knows the solution.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: When the subject is “Neither…nor…” and the second noun is plural (“assistants”), the verb must agree in plural form.

questionContent.body: She insisted that he goes to the doctor immediately.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In subjunctive mood (used after verbs like “insist,” “recommend”), we use the base form: “he go.”

questionContent.body: The number of road accidents have increased over the last five years.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: When “The number of” is used, the verb should be singular. “The number of accidents has increased.”

questionContent.body: Everyone in the class, including the teacher, have arrived for the presentation.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Everyone” is a singular indefinite pronoun, so the verb must be singular: has arrived.

questionContent.body: Neither the books nor the pen are missing from the bag.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: With “neither/nor,” the verb agrees with the noun closest to it. “Pen” is singular, so we use “is.”

questionContent.body: The company has layed off several employees this year.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The past tense of “lay off” is “laid off.” “Layed” is an incorrect form.

questionContent.body: If I was you, I wouldn’t ignore this opportunity.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In hypothetical or imaginary situations, we use “were” instead of “was” with all subjects. This is the subjunctive mood.

questionContent.body: The teacher, along with her students, were attending the seminar.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is “The teacher,” which is singular. The phrase “along with her students” does not change the subject-verb agreement.

questionContent.body: He neither apologized nor he tried to explain his actions.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The correct correlative conjunction structure here should use auxiliary inversion: “nor did he try.”

questionContent.body: Either the team members or the captain have to take responsibility.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: When using “either/or,” the verb agrees with the subject closer to it. “Captain” is singular, so use “has.”

questionContent.body: The manager asked if the reports was submitted on time.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject “reports” is plural, so we use “were.”

questionContent.body: No sooner had he reached the station when the train departed.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The correct correlative conjunction is “No sooner…than.”

questionContent.body: He is one of those players who has won multiple awards.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Those players who have won…” refers to multiple players. The verb should agree with “players,” not “one.”

questionContent.body: The book, together with the notes, are missing from the shelf.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject “The book” is singular. The phrase “together with the notes” is additional information and does not change the number of the subject.

questionContent.body: The number of participants have increased significantly this year.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “The number” is a singular subject, so use “has.”

questionContent.body: Neither of the two answers are correct.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Neither” is singular, so it takes a singular verb—“is correct.”

questionContent.body: Scarcely had the show started when the lights went off.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The correct phrase is “Scarcely...when.” It expresses an event quickly followed by another.

questionContent.body: Each of the applicants have submitted their resume.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Each” is always singular, so use “has.”

questionContent.body: The teacher, along with her students, were attending the seminar.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is “The teacher” (singular). “Along with her students” is a modifying phrase and doesn’t affect the verb agreement.

questionContent.body: No sooner had he stepped out when it started to rain.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The correct correlative phrase is “No sooner… than,” not “when.”

questionContent.body: The data collected from various sources is being analyzed.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In modern usage, “data” is often treated as a singular mass noun when referring to information.

questionContent.body: He is one of those employees who always arrive on time.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Who” refers to “those employees” (plural), so the verb should be plural—“arrive.”

questionContent.body: The bouquet of roses smell delightful.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject “bouquet” is singular, so it takes “smells.”

questionContent.body: Neither the manager nor his assistants was able to solve the issue.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: When using “neither...nor,” the verb agrees with the subject closest to it—in this case, “assistants” (plural), so use “were able.”

questionContent.body: There is many reasons to support this proposal.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Reasons” is plural, so the correct verb is “are.”

questionContent.body: The teacher, along with her students, were attending the seminar.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is “The teacher,” which is singular. The phrase “along with her students” does not affect the verb.

questionContent.body: The number of road accidents have decreased over the past year.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “The number” is a singular phrase, so use “has decreased.”

questionContent.body: Each of the students have completed their assignments on time.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Each” is singular, so it takes the singular verb “has completed.”

questionContent.body: Not only the kids but also their mother enjoy the movie.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In “not only... but also” sentences, the verb agrees with the closest subject—“mother” (singular), so use “enjoys.”

questionContent.body: The bouquet of flowers look beautiful on the table.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Bouquet” is a singular subject, so the verb should be “looks.”

questionContent.body: By the time he arrives, we have finished our lunch.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: For actions completed in the future before another action, use future perfect tense.

questionContent.body: The committee have submitted their report.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: "Committee" is a collective noun and is treated as singular when acting as a single unit.

questionContent.body: Neither the teacher nor the students was aware of the schedule change.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In "neither...nor" constructions, the verb agrees with the noun closest to it—“students” (plural), so use "were."

questionContent.body: She speaks as if she knows everything.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The phrase "as if" is followed by the subjunctive mood—"knew," not "knows."

questionContent.body: Either the manager or his assistants is going to attend the seminar.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In “either…or” constructions, the verb agrees with the subject closest to it—“assistants” (plural), so "are going" is correct.

questionContent.body: The news that was broadcast last night were disturbing.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “News” is uncountable and takes a singular verb—“was.”

questionContent.body: One of the best players on the team are injured.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is "One," which is singular, so the verb must be "is."

questionContent.body: The number of participants in the workshop have increased significantly.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The number" is treated as singular, so it takes "has increased."

questionContent.body: The committee have decided to postpone the event due to weather conditions.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Committee” is a collective noun and generally takes a singular verb—“has decided.”

questionContent.body: He don’t know how to operate the new software.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Third person singular requires “doesn’t” + base verb—“doesn’t know.”

questionContent.body: Neither the rain nor the strong winds has stopped the event.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: With “neither...nor,” the verb agrees with the subject closest to it—“winds” (plural), so "have stopped" is correct.

questionContent.body: The bouquet of roses smell lovely in the morning.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is "bouquet," which is singular, so it takes "smells."

questionContent.body: Each of the candidates have submitted their documents.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Each" is singular and takes a singular verb—"has submitted

questionContent.body: If I was you, I would not ignore the warning signs.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Subjunctive mood requires "were" for hypothetical situations—If I were you

questionContent.body: She is one of the players who deserves special recognition.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Who deserve" refers to "players" (plural), not "she", so the verb must be plural.

questionContent.body: The number of participants in the workshop are increasing every year.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The number of" is treated as singular, so the verb should be singular—"is increasing

questionContent.body: Neither the teacher nor the students was aware of the change in schedule.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: When using "neither...nor", the verb agrees with the subject closer to it. "Students" is plural, so "were" is correct.

questionContent.body: The manager, along with his team members, have arrived at the conference hall.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: When "along with" is used, the verb agrees with the subject before it. Here, "manager" is singular.

questionContent.body: The book that you gave me are interesting.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject "book" is singular, so the verb must be "is."

questionContent.body: If I was you, I would take the opportunity.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In conditional sentences expressing hypotheticals, use "were" with "I."

questionContent.body: This pair of shoes are expensive.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: "Pair" is singular, so we use "is."

questionContent.body: The teacher, along with her students, were present.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The subject is "The teacher" (singular), so the verb should be "is."

questionContent.body: He is one of the players who has performed well.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: "Who have performed" refers to "players," which is plural.

questionContent.body: The information provided to us were inaccurate.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Information” is an uncountable noun and takes a singular verb.

questionContent.body: She is more intelligent then her sister.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Than” is used for comparisons, not “then.”

questionContent.body: Neither of the students have completed their homework.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Neither” is singular and should be followed by “has.”

questionContent.body: The team are winning the match easily.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “The team” is a collective noun and usually takes a singular verb in American English.

questionContent.body: Each of the boys are playing in the field.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: “Each” is singular and takes a singular verb. So, "is" is correct.

questionContent.body:
Urbanization and Its Effect on Human Lifestyle


Urbanization—the increasing number of people living in cities—has been one of the most significant global trends of the past century. With more than half of the world’s population now residing in urban areas, this shift has brought profound changes to human lifestyle, both positive and negative.

On the positive side, urban areas often provide better access to healthcare, education, job opportunities, and public services. Cities act as hubs of innovation, culture, and economic growth. Many people migrate from rural areas to urban centers in search of a better quality of life.

However, rapid urbanization also brings several challenges. Overcrowding, traffic congestion, pollution, and rising living costs are common issues faced by city dwellers. In many developing nations, the pace of urban development has outstripped the ability of infrastructure to keep up, resulting in slums, inadequate sanitation, and environmental degradation.

Urban lifestyles also tend to be more sedentary, leading to increased health issues such as obesity and stress-related disorders. Additionally, the fast-paced nature of city life can lead to a decline in community bonding and mental well-being.

As urbanization continues, there is a growing need for sustainable development and better city planning to ensure that urban growth enhances, rather than diminishes, the quality of life for all residents.


What solution does the author suggest for the challenges posed by urbanization?

questionOptions.body: Encouraging people to move back to rural areas

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The author emphasizes the need for sustainable development and improved urban planning to address urbanization challenges.

questionContent.body:
Urbanization and Its Effect on Human Lifestyle


Urbanization—the increasing number of people living in cities—has been one of the most significant global trends of the past century. With more than half of the world’s population now residing in urban areas, this shift has brought profound changes to human lifestyle, both positive and negative.

On the positive side, urban areas often provide better access to healthcare, education, job opportunities, and public services. Cities act as hubs of innovation, culture, and economic growth. Many people migrate from rural areas to urban centers in search of a better quality of life.

However, rapid urbanization also brings several challenges. Overcrowding, traffic congestion, pollution, and rising living costs are common issues faced by city dwellers. In many developing nations, the pace of urban development has outstripped the ability of infrastructure to keep up, resulting in slums, inadequate sanitation, and environmental degradation.

Urban lifestyles also tend to be more sedentary, leading to increased health issues such as obesity and stress-related disorders. Additionally, the fast-paced nature of city life can lead to a decline in community bonding and mental well-being.

As urbanization continues, there is a growing need for sustainable development and better city planning to ensure that urban growth enhances, rather than diminishes, the quality of life for all residents.


What is one major reason for slums and inadequate sanitation in urban areas?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The passage states that in many countries, urban development is faster than infrastructure can keep up with.

questionContent.body:
The History and Influence of the Internet


The internet, originally developed as a military communication network during the Cold War, has evolved into one of the most transformative inventions in human history. What began as ARPANET in the late 1960s has grown into a global platform that connects billions of people across the world.

The commercial adoption of the internet in the 1990s revolutionized how people access information, communicate, and do business. It gave rise to email, social media, e-commerce, and cloud computing—changing the fabric of everyday life. Today, people rely on the internet for education, work, entertainment, and even social interactions.

However, the internet's influence has not been entirely positive. The rise of misinformation, cybercrime, digital addiction, and data privacy concerns has created new challenges for individuals and governments. As the digital landscape continues to evolve, striking a balance between innovation and regulation is crucial.

Despite the drawbacks, the internet has become an essential tool for global development. It has amplified voices, democratized access to knowledge, and enabled remote work and learning opportunities, especially during times of crisis like the COVID-19 pandemic.


What role did the internet play during the COVID-19 pandemic?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The passage notes that the internet enabled remote work and learning during the pandemic.

questionContent.body:
Wildlife Conservation and Endangered Species


Wildlife conservation plays a vital role in maintaining ecological balance and preserving the planet’s biodiversity. With human expansion, deforestation, climate change, and poaching on the rise, many animal species are facing extinction. According to recent reports, nearly one million species are threatened due to human activities.

Conservation efforts aim to protect these species and their habitats through initiatives like wildlife sanctuaries, breeding programs, anti-poaching laws, and awareness campaigns. Organizations across the globe work together with governments to enforce strict regulations and educate the public on the importance of protecting wildlife.

The loss of even a single species can disrupt entire ecosystems. For instance, the disappearance of pollinators like bees can affect food production and biodiversity. Protecting endangered species is not just about animals—it’s about safeguarding our future as well.

While progress has been made, much more needs to be done. Public involvement and strong political will are essential in ensuring the survival of endangered species. Without immediate and collective action, future generations may only know many species from pictures in history books.


What tone does the author use in discussing wildlife conservation?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The author urges immediate and collective action and emphasizes the seriousness of the issue.

questionContent.body:
Education in the Digital Era


The advent of the digital era has transformed almost every aspect of education. Classrooms are no longer confined to four walls; students can now access lectures, resources, and even degrees through online platforms. E-learning tools such as video tutorials, online quizzes, and virtual classrooms have made learning more flexible and accessible.

One of the most significant benefits of digital education is its inclusivity. Students from remote areas or with physical limitations can participate in the same learning experiences as others. Moreover, personalized learning has gained popularity, allowing students to progress at their own pace using adaptive technologies.

Despite these advantages, digital learning comes with its challenges. Issues like lack of internet access, distraction from devices, and reduced social interaction among students can hinder the learning experience. Teachers also face difficulties in managing and engaging students effectively in a virtual environment.

Nevertheless, with the right infrastructure and training, digital education holds the potential to make learning more innovative, engaging, and effective. The key is to balance traditional teaching methods with digital tools to cater to the diverse needs of students.


What is the tone of the author regarding digital education?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The author acknowledges both benefits and challenges, presenting a balanced view.

questionContent.body:
Social Media — Boon or Bane


Social media has revolutionized the way people communicate, access information, and express themselves. Platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn have brought the world closer, allowing individuals to share ideas and stories instantly. For many, social media is a powerful tool for networking, learning, and creating awareness on various issues.

However, the same platforms have also raised serious concerns. The spread of misinformation, online bullying, and the impact on mental health—especially among teenagers—are major challenges. Studies suggest excessive use of social media can lead to anxiety, low self-esteem, and addiction.

Despite its drawbacks, social media has proven to be an effective medium for activism and social change. Movements like #MeToo and climate justice campaigns gained momentum through viral posts and global engagement.

The key lies in how social media is used. When used responsibly, it can be an asset to society; when misused, it can cause harm. Striking the right balance between freedom and responsibility is essential to harness the true potential of social media.


How does the passage present social media overall?

questionOptions.body: As a tool that can be both helpful and harmful

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The title and conclusion emphasize both the pros and cons, making it a balanced view.

questionContent.body:
The Rise of Renewable Energy Sources


The global energy landscape is undergoing a significant transformation as countries increasingly turn to renewable energy sources like solar, wind, hydro, and geothermal power. Unlike fossil fuels, renewables are sustainable, do not emit harmful greenhouse gases, and are seen as vital in combating climate change.

Technological advancements have made renewable energy more efficient and affordable. For example, the cost of solar panels has dropped dramatically in the past decade, making solar power a viable option for homes and businesses. Wind energy, too, has become a major contributor to power generation in many countries.

Governments and private organizations are investing heavily in renewable infrastructure. Incentives, subsidies, and long-term policies have encouraged innovation and adoption. In some countries, renewables already make up a significant portion of the energy mix.

However, challenges such as energy storage, grid integration, and intermittent power supply need to be addressed to ensure reliability. Researchers are actively working on battery technologies and smart grids to overcome these obstacles.

The shift to renewable energy not only supports environmental goals but also creates jobs and promotes energy independence. As awareness grows, the world moves closer to a cleaner, more sustainable future.


How does the rise of renewable energy affect employment?

questionOptions.body: It reduces job opportunities in all sectors

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The final paragraph mentions that renewable energy promotes job creation and energy independence.

The shift to renewable energy not only supports environmental goals but also creates jobs and promotes energy independence. As awareness grows, the world moves closer to a cleaner, more sustainable future.


What role do governments play in promoting renewable energy?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: According to the passage, governments provide subsidies and long-term policies to support renewables.

questionContent.body:
Mental Health Awareness Among Youth


In recent years, there has been a growing recognition of the importance of mental health, particularly among the youth. As academic pressure, social media influence, and career uncertainty continue to increase, many young people are facing heightened levels of anxiety, depression, and stress. Unfortunately, stigma and lack of awareness often prevent open discussions about mental well-being.

Schools and universities are beginning to implement mental health programs, providing students with counseling services and stress management workshops. Social media campaigns have also helped raise awareness, encouraging young individuals to seek help and support each other.

Despite these efforts, challenges remain. Many students still fear judgment or are unsure where to find professional help. Cultural factors also play a role in how mental health is perceived and addressed. In some communities, emotional struggles are dismissed as weakness or ignored altogether.

Promoting mental health awareness is essential not only for academic performance but also for overall well-being. Encouraging open conversations, educating parents and teachers, and integrating mental health into school curricula are key steps in building a supportive environment for the younger generation.


What does the author suggest is necessary to improve mental health among youth?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The author emphasizes the importance of open dialogue, education, and supportive environments for better mental health.

questionContent.body:
Cultural Diversity and Globalization


Globalization has led to an increasingly interconnected world, bringing people, products, ideas, and cultures closer than ever before. As a result, cultural diversity has become both more visible and more complex. On one hand, globalization promotes the exchange of traditions, cuisines, languages, and lifestyles. People today can enjoy sushi in Paris, listen to K-pop in the U.S., or learn yoga in Europe. This cultural blending enriches societies and promotes mutual understanding.

However, there are also concerns that globalization might lead to cultural homogenization, where dominant cultures overshadow smaller or indigenous ones. Critics argue that global consumerism, driven by large corporations, tends to promote a few popular cultures while neglecting others. As fast food chains, movies, and fashion brands expand globally, some local traditions risk being forgotten.

Balancing the benefits of cultural exchange with the need to preserve unique identities is a growing challenge. Cultural diversity contributes to innovation, creativity, and social resilience. Therefore, governments, educational institutions, and communities are making efforts to preserve endangered languages, promote local art, and celebrate cultural festivals.

Globalization is not inherently negative for cultural diversity, but it demands conscious efforts to protect and promote the richness of human heritage while embracing a global perspective.


What is the author’s overall tone regarding globalization and cultural diversity?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The author acknowledges both the benefits and risks of globalization and stresses the importance of conscious efforts to preserve culture.

questionContent.body:
The Evolution of Space Exploration


Space exploration has come a long way since the launch of the first artificial satellite, Sputnik 1, in 1957 by the Soviet Union. This marked the beginning of the space age and sparked a fierce competition between nations, particularly the United States and the USSR, known as the "Space Race." One of the most iconic moments came in 1969 when Neil Armstrong became the first human to set foot on the moon.

In recent decades, space exploration has shifted from being a government-only venture to involving private companies like SpaceX, Blue Origin, and others. These companies have revolutionized the field by introducing reusable rockets and significantly lowering the cost of space travel.

The focus of space missions has also evolved. Earlier, the objective was to prove technological superiority. Today, the goals include studying other planets for signs of life, mining asteroids for resources, and even colonizing Mars. Technological advancements have made it possible to send rovers, satellites, and telescopes deeper into the universe, unlocking new mysteries of space.

Despite the progress, space exploration still faces many challenges, such as radiation exposure, long-duration space travel, and the need for sustainable life-support systems. Yet, the quest to understand our universe continues to inspire innovation and international collaboration.


According to the passage, what continues to inspire space exploration despite its challenges?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The final line of the passage says the "quest to understand our universe" continues to drive innovation and collaboration.

questionContent.body:
Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Jobs


Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing industries across the globe. From automating simple tasks to making complex decisions, AI has become a vital part of modern businesses. While it offers improved efficiency and accuracy, it also raises concerns about job displacement.

Many routine and repetitive jobs are being replaced by AI-driven systems. However, AI is also creating new opportunities that require human oversight, creativity, and emotional intelligence—skills that machines lack. The World Economic Forum predicts that while millions of jobs may be lost to automation, millions more will be created in areas such as AI development, data analysis, and cybersecurity.

To stay relevant in the job market, individuals must adapt by upskilling and reskilling. Governments and organizations are encouraged to invest in education and training programs to prepare workers for the evolving demands of the workplace.

Rather than replacing humans entirely, AI is more likely to transform job roles. The future of work will depend on a collaborative relationship between humans and machines, where AI handles routine functions and humans focus on strategic and interpersonal tasks.


How is AI expected to change the workplace, according to the passage?

questionOptions.body: It will create a more competitive environment
It will transform job roles and encourage human-AI collaboration
It will lead to shorter work weeks

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The passage concludes that AI will transform, not replace, job roles, leading to collaboration between humans and machines.

questionContent.body:
Gender Equality in the Modern Workplace


Gender equality in the workplace has gained significant attention over the past few decades. Many companies have started implementing policies to ensure that men and women are treated equally in terms of pay, promotion, and opportunities. Despite progress, challenges such as the gender pay gap, underrepresentation of women in leadership roles, and unconscious bias continue to exist.

Studies have shown that diverse workplaces, where both genders have equal participation, tend to perform better financially and creatively. Women bring unique perspectives and problem-solving approaches that enhance team performance and innovation.

However, achieving true equality requires more than just policies. It involves changing deep-rooted mindsets, promoting inclusive leadership, and creating a culture where all employees feel valued and heard. Training programs, mentorship opportunities for women, and transparent performance evaluations are some ways organizations can foster gender parity.

As society evolves, the demand for fair and inclusive work environments continues to grow. Empowering women in the workplace is not just a matter of fairness; it’s a strategic advantage for any organization seeking long-term success.


What is implied about policies alone in promoting gender equality?

questionOptions.body: Policies must be supported by cultural and mindset changes

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The passage clearly states that policies are helpful but must be backed by inclusive culture and mindset shifts.

Many companies have started implementing policies to ensure that men and women are treated equally in terms of pay, promotion, and opportunities. Despite progress, challenges such as the gender pay gap, underrepresentation of women in leadership roles, and unconscious bias continue to exist.

Studies have shown that diverse workplaces, where both genders have equal participation, tend to perform better financially and creatively. Women bring unique perspectives and problem-solving approaches that enhance team performance and innovation.

However, achieving true equality requires more than just policies. It involves changing deep-rooted mindsets, promoting inclusive leadership, and creating a culture where all employees feel valued and heard. Training programs, mentorship opportunities for women, and transparent performance evaluations are some ways organizations can foster gender parity.

As society evolves, the demand for fair and inclusive work environments continues to grow. Empowering women in the workplace is not just a matter of fairness; it’s a strategic advantage for any organization seeking long-term success.


According to the passage, which of the following remains a challenge to gender equality?

questionOptions.body: Unconscious bias and fewer women in leadership roles

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The passage mentions the gender pay gap, underrepresentation, and unconscious bias as persistent issues.

questionContent.body:
The Impact of Climate Change on Global Agriculture


Climate change poses a significant threat to agriculture worldwide. Rising temperatures, unpredictable rainfall patterns, and an increase in extreme weather events have made farming more challenging than ever before. Crops such as wheat, rice, and maize, which are essential for feeding the global population, are highly sensitive to temperature fluctuations.

In developing countries, where agriculture is a primary source of income, these impacts are particularly devastating. Farmers face reduced crop yields and increased pest infestations, leading to food insecurity and economic hardship. Moreover, water scarcity caused by prolonged droughts affects irrigation and livestock, further worsening the situation.

To combat these effects, scientists are working on climate-resilient crops that can withstand higher temperatures and require less water. Additionally, improved farming practices such as crop rotation, better irrigation systems, and sustainable land use can help minimize the adverse impacts of climate change.

Governments and international organizations must also play a role by supporting research, providing financial aid to affected farmers, and promoting policies aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Addressing climate change is essential not just for agriculture, but for the sustainability of the planet as a whole.



What role should governments play in mitigating the agricultural impact of climate change?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The passage suggests that governments and international organizations should support research, funding, and policies.
